§ 3506. Copies of laws A master of a passenger vessel shall keep on board a copy of this subtitle, to be provided by the Secretary at reasonable cost. If the master fails to do so, the master is liable to the United States Government for a civil penalty of $200. (Pub. L. 98–89, Aug. 26, 1983, 97 Stat. 520.)
Historical and Revision Notes
Revised sectionSource section (U.S. Code)
350646:492
Section 3506 requires the master of a passenger vessel to keep on board a copy of subtitle II of title 46, U.S.C. Copies of the subtitle shall be provided by the Secretary at reasonable cost.
